answers.answer: Since adipex is a weight loss drug, I would assume that you wanted to lose weight??Following is an excerpt that I copied regarding the use of adipex ----"Adipex-P, an appetite suppressant, is prescribed for short-term use as part of an overall weight reduction program that also includes dieting, exercise, and counseling. The drug is for use only by excessively overweight individuals who have a condition—such as diabetes, high blood pressure, or high cholesterol—that could lead to serious medical problems."If you are losing faster than you want and are not feeling right, you should stop taking it and see your doctor.  Some people can have adverse effects from weight loss pills.  And if you are "forgetting" to eat, the most likely your boyfriend is right that you are not getting the right food.  You need a good balance of lean protein, low/no fat dairy, whole grains, fruits and veggies, "good" fats, etc.........My first suggestion, though is that you see your doctor.

question: I am taking Adipex-p 37.8. I have lost 15 pounds within a mouth of taking it. I am now starting to feel, weak I don't  eat alot of food now because I am not hungry. What should I do, I execrise for thirty minutes to an hour a day. My boyfriend don't think I am eating the right food. I sometimes forget to eat to. Please help me I don't want to get off the pill, but it looks that way. Oh yeah I don't like milk, or eggs. So if you any suggestions please feel free to include.
title: Calorie intake
